sen.j: 太田 資始（おおた すけもと）は、江戸時代後期から幕末にかけての大名、老中。
sen.e: Suketomo OTA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor) from the late Edo period to the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate.
Sukemoto OTA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor) from the late Edo period to the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate.
Sukemoto OTA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor) from the late Edo period to the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate.

sen.j: 遠江国掛川藩第5代藩主。
sen.e: He was the fifth lord of Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province.
He was the fifth lord of Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province.
He was the fifth lord of Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province.

sen.j: 掛川藩太田家9代。
sen.e: He was the ninth head of the Ota family in Kakegawa Domain.
He was the ninth head of the Ota family in Kakegawa Domain.
He was the ninth head of the Ota family in Kakegawa Domain.

sen.j: 近江国堅田藩主・堀田正穀の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Masazane HOTTA, lord of Katada Domain in Omi Province.
He was the third son of Masazane HOTTA, the lord of Katada Domain in Omi Province.
He was the third son of Masazane HOTTA, the lord of Katada Domain in Omi Province.

sen.j: 太田資言の娘婿となり、掛川藩主を継ぐ。
sen.e: As a son-in-law, he took over Suketoki OTA's position in the lord of Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province.
As a son in law through marriage, he took over Suketoki OTA's position in the lord of Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: through marriageを追加アポストロフィを半角に
sen.e: As a son in law through marriage, he took over Suketoki OTA's position in the lord of Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province.

sen.j: 11代将軍・徳川家斉の側近として寺社奉行、京都所司代、大坂城代などを歴任し、天保5年（1834年）に老中となった。
sen.e: He held various positions as a close retainer to the eleventh shogun Ienari TOKUGAWA, such as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Kyoto shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle), and became a roju in 1834.

He held various positions as a close retainer to the eleventh shogun Ienari TOKUGAWA, such as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Kyoto shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle), and became a roju in 1834.

He held various positions as a close retainer to the eleventh shogun Ienari TOKUGAWA, such as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Kyoto shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle), and became a roju in 1834.

sen.j: しかし、老中首座の水野忠邦とソリが会わず、上知令、庄内藩転封、倹約令などにそのつど反対を標榜し、挙句、忠邦を幕閣を放逐せんとして策謀をめぐらし、水戸に帰国していた水戸藩主徳川斉昭に出府を要請し、斉昭を背後から操って忠邦の天保の改革を潰そうと画策した。
sen.e: However, he did not get along with Tadakuni MIZUNO, who was the head of roju, as he made objections to Agechi-rei (confiscation command of territory), Shonai tenpu (changing the territory to Shonai Domain) and Kenyaku-rei (laws regulating expenditures); on top of these, in an attempt to drive Tadakuni out of the government, he requested Nariaki TOKUGAWA, head of Mito Domain who was then back home, to go to Edo, and plotted to hinder Tadakuni's Tenpo Reforms by masterminding Nariaki.

However, he did not get along with Tadakuni MIZUNO, who was the head of roju, as he made objections to Agechi-rei (confiscation command of territory), Shonai tenpu (changing the territory to Shonai Domain) and Kenyaku-rei (laws regulating expenditures); on top of these, in an attempt to drive Tadakuni out of the government, he requested Nariaki TOKUGAWA, head of Mito Domain who was then back home, to go to Edo, and plotted to hinder Tadakuni's Tenpo Reforms by masterminding Nariaki.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを半角に
sen.e: However, he did not get along with Tadakuni MIZUNO, who was the head of roju, as he made objections to Agechi-rei (confiscation command of territory), Shonai tenpu (changing the territory to Shonai Domain) and Kenyaku-rei (laws regulating expenditures); on top of these, in an attempt to drive Tadakuni out of the government, he requested Nariaki TOKUGAWA, head of Mito Domain who was then back home, to go to Edo, and plotted to hinder Tadakuni's Tenpo Reforms by masterminding Nariaki.

sen.j: しかしこれは斉昭が出府を拒否したうえ、忠邦にこの動きが漏れ、逆に資始のほうが天保12年（1841年）6月、老中から免職され隠居した。
sen.e: But Nariaki refused to go to Edo, and Tadakuni found this out, which then forced Suketomo into resignation and retirement in June 1841.
But Nariaki refused to go to Edo, and Tadakuni found this out, which then forced Sukemoto into resignation and retirement in June 1841.
But Nariaki refused to go to Edo, and Tadakuni found this out, which then forced Sukemoto into resignation and retirement in June 1841.

sen.j: 後は長男の太田資功が継いでいる。
sen.e: He was taken over by his eldest son Sukekatsu OTA.
He was taken over by his eldest son Sukekatsu OTA.
He was taken over by his eldest son Sukekatsu OTA.

sen.j: 次に老中に再任されたのが安政5年（1858年）である。
sen.e: He was reappointed as roju in 1858.
He was reappointed as roju in 1858.
He was reappointed as roju in 1858.

sen.j: 大老井伊直弼は、堀田正睦、松平忠固を罷免する代わりに太田ら老中経験者3人を老中に起用した。
sen.e: Tairo (chief minister) Naosuke II appointed three of those who had been roju, including OTA, as roju, instead of dismissing Masazane HOTTA and Tadakata MATSUDAIRA.
Tairo (chief minister) Naosuke II dismissed Masayoshi HOTTA and Tadakata MATSUDAIRA, and in place of them, appointed three of those who had been roju, including OTA, as roju.
sen.cmt: instead of dismissing → in place ofMasazane → Masayoshi
sen.e: Tairo (chief minister) Naosuke II dismissed Masayoshi HOTTA and Tadakata MATSUDAIRA, and in place of them, appointed three of those who had been roju, including OTA, as roju.

sen.j: 既に家督を譲った隠居を老中に起用するのは大変異例なことであった。
sen.e: It was very unusual to appoint as roju someone who had been no longer in the reign of his family and already retired.
It was very unusual to appoint as roju someone who had been no longer in the reign of his family and already retired.
It was very unusual to appoint as roju someone who had been no longer in the reign of his family and already retired.

sen.j: 隠居のため役領3万俵を支給された。
sen.e: He was given an allowance of 30,000 hyo for retirement.
sen.cmt: ※「役領」は「役料」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Since he was already retired, 30,000 hyo was given as an allowance.
sen.cmt: 原文の解釈が違うと考えて再構成しました。
sen.e: Since he was already retired, 30,000 hyo was given as an allowance.

sen.j: しかし、ここでも資始と井伊直弼は尊王倒幕志士らの弾圧をめぐって意見が対立。
sen.e: However, Suketomo and Naosuke II locked horns again over clamp down on anti-shogunate royalists.
However, Sukemoto and Naosuke II locked horns again over clamp down on anti-shogunate royalists.
However, Sukemoto and Naosuke II locked horns again over clamp down on anti-shogunate royalists.

sen.j: 安政6年（1859年）、再び老中を放逐された。
sen.e: He was dismissed from roju again in 1859.
He was dismissed from roju again in 1859.
He was dismissed from roju again in 1859.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）に老中に三度目の就任をしたが在職一ヶ月で辞職。
sen.e: In 1863, he became roju for the third time, but resigned after one month.
In 1863, he became roju for the third time, but resigned after one month.
In 1863, he became roju for the third time, but resigned after one month.

sen.j: 幕府はなおも老練な資始を老中に迎えようとしたが話がまとまらないうちに死去した。
sen.e: The bakufu (shogunate) tried to have the experienced Suketomo as roju, but did not end in success when he was alive.
The bakufu (shogunate) still tried to have the experienced Sukemoto as roju, but did not end in success when he was alive.
The bakufu (shogunate) still tried to have the experienced Sukemoto as roju, but did not end in success when he was alive.

sen.j: 墓所：静岡県三島市玉沢の妙法華寺。
sen.e: His tomb is in Myohokke-ji Temple in Tamazawa, Mishima City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
His tomb is in Myohokke-ji Temple in Tamazawa, Mishima City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
His tomb is in Myohokke-ji Temple in Tamazawa, Mishima City, Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 年譜
sen.e: Chronological History
Chronological History
Chronological History

sen.j: 寛政11年（1799年） 生誕
sen.e: Born in 1799.
Born in 1799.
Born in 1799.

sen.j: 文政5年（1822年） 寺社奉行（7月17日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Became jisha-bugyo on July 17 in 1822 on the old calendar.
Became jisha-bugyo on September 2, in 1822.
September 2, 1822: Became jisha-bugyo.

sen.j: 文政11年（1828年） 大坂城代（11月22日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Became Osaka jodai on November 22 in 1828 on the old calendar.
Became Osaka jodai on December 28, in 1828 on the old calendar.
December 28, 1828: Became Osaka jodai.

sen.j: 天保2年（1831年） 京都所司代
sen.e: Became Kyoto shoshidai in 1831.
Became Kyoto shoshidai in 1831.
1831: Became Kyoto shoshidai.

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年） 西の丸老中
sen.e: Became nishinomaru roju (roju in the western districts of a castle) in 1834.
Became nishinomaru roju (roju in the western districts of a castle) in 1834.
1834: Became nishinomaru roju (roju in the western districts of a castle).

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年） 本丸老中（4月2日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Became honmaru roju (roju in the keep of a castle) on April 2 in 1837 on the old calendar.
Became honmaru roju (roju in the keep of a castle) on May 6, in 1837.
May 6, 1837: Became honmaru roju (roju in the keep of a castle).

sen.j: 天保12年（1841年） 老中免職、隠居（6月3日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Dismissed from roju and retired on June 23 in 1841 on the old calendar.
Dismissed from roju and retired on August 9, in 1841.
August 9, 1841: Dismissed from roju and retired.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年） 老中に再任（6月23日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Reappointed as roju on June 23 in 1858 on the old calendar.
Reappointed as roju on August 2, in 1858.
August 2, 1858: Reappointed as roju.

sen.j: 安政6年（1859年） 老中免職（7月23日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Dismissed from roju on July 23 in 1859 on the old calendar.
Dismissed from roju on August 21, in 1859.
August 21, 1859: Dismissed from roju.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年） 老中に3度目の就任（4月27日 (旧暦)）、1ヶ月で辞任（5月14日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: Appointed as roju for the third time on April 27 in 1863 on the old calendar and resigned one month later on May 14.
Appointed as roju for the third time on June 13, in 1863 and resigned one month later on June 29.
June 13, 1863: Appointed as roju for the third time and resigned one month later on June 29.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年） 死去。
sen.e: Died in 1867.
Died in 1867.
1867: Died.

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: He was 68 years old.
Died at the age of 68.
Died at the age of 68.
